title.narrative: Monitoring and Evaluation for the Canadian International Food Security Research Fund
Suivi et évaluation du Fonds canadien de recherche sur la sécurité alimentaire internationale

description.narrative:
The Canadian International Food Security Research Fund (CIFSRF) needs to track, organize, analyze, and share research results from the research projects it is funding.
CIFSRF is a five-year, $62 million program jointly funded by the Canadian International Development Agency (CIDA) and IDRC. The Fund supports partnerships between organizations in Canada and in developing countries to conduct applied research on issues related to food security in developing regions.
The support provided by this grant will allow CIFSRF to effectively monitor and communicate research findings and outcomes. The Fund needs to be able to share findings and outcomes with relevant policy and programming decision-makers to ensure greater policy uptake. It must also do this for general reasons of accountability and transparency.
The work covered by this project support complements monitoring and communications activities done at the project level by CIFSRF grantees. This higher level of monitoring and communications will allow IDRC to synthesize information on results at a program level.
Specifically, this project will allow CIFSRF to create or produce - a monitoring database to track, organize, and analyze qualitative and quantitative research results; - project updates that communicate progress, outputs, and early results of funded projects; - outcome stories that convey early and intermediate results and successes; and - a knowledge translation strategy that will guide future programming and help policymakers understand the impacts of the research.
